note.p: Birth: Grafton, New South Wales, Australia (15 August 1871)
Education: Sydney High School; University of Sydney. MD (1895, first student to pass this exam at Sydney); MA (Cambridge)

Career: Demonstrator, Department of Anatomy, University of Sydney (1894); won scholarship to Cambridge University (1896); Fellow, St John's College, Cambridge (1899); Professor of Anatomy, Government Medical School, Cairo (1900); studied mummification; Professor of Anatomy, University of Manchester (1909); Professor of Anatomy, University College, London (1919); involved in the establishment of a department of anthropology, University of Sydney (1924); retired from University College, London (1936)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; AE
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1936-1938 vol 2 pp 323-333, plate, by J T Wilson
